lines.text: Oh, I love my family, but I'd give my six kids to get rid of my wife.
Your Excellency - he took bribes, he drank all my wine, he-he-he yelled out the windows, he even made love to my wife! How could... How could I doubt that he was an Inspector General?
May I become a wandering gypsy if I'm not telling the truth.
But you ARE a wandering gypsy.
That proves I'm telling the truth.

[singing]
Drink to me only wi-ith thine eye-eyes / And I will drink with my nose!

[singing to himself on how to pull off the scam]
Be arrogant, be elegant, be smart!

[making up code for "arrogance, elegance, and smarts"]
Give 'em the fist, give 'em the wrist, give 'em the finger!
The Inspector General. Yes, he has full power from the Emperor himself. And wherever he finds bribery and corruption, there the gallows and the firing squad go to work. More.
[the newly deposed Mayor of Klimenti is immediately given more wine to calm him]
What does he look like, this Inspector General?
Who knows? A man of mystery. Five days he was in our midst and no one even suspected it. He went everywhere, saw everything, and uncovered such corruption that even I was shocked.
The hospital - have you cleaned it up?
Well, you could eat off the floors. We put sheets on the bed, and we got the goats out of surgery. I put charts on the foot of each patient's bed indicating the nature of their illness.
Good. Now at least they'll know what they died from.

[hearing that a stranger's been arrested who might be the Inspector General in disguise]
You idiot. Did you search him? Question him?
Well... it was so near lunchtime.
This is a nice jail. Really it is. We've had some wonderful hangings here.

[nervously]
Oh, I have no wife. None of my family had wives. My father didn't like wives. I mean, my mother didn't like my father's wives.
You'll regret this, you fat-faced village idiot!
What! You... you... How dare you!
Keep your dirty hands off me, you misbegotten peasants!
Tie him up!

The Emperor will tear this stinking village down over your ears, you thieving lard-bucket! Heads will roll here like marbles - yours first, and then this flea-ridden sack of nothing you call the Inspector General!
Oh! Why, he's insane! Take him away! Take him away!

This isn't the Inspector General! Don't make me laugh! The great Emperor wouldn't appoint a thing like this to a post of such importance! THIS is your Inspector General! Here! His carriage, his manner, his bearing. Gentlemen, take your choice.
